intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium picoeuropeanum, commonly known as the European hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many parts of its native range.
